intro: Artemisia capillaris var. scoparia, commonly known as Chinese wormwood, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It is characterized by its aromatic, finely divided gray-green leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in late summer. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in moist or wetland habitats. Its essential oils contain compounds like thujone and camphor, which contribute to its medicinal and aromatic properties. It is widely used in traditional Chinese medicine for its purported detoxifying and digestive benefits.
